slides.title: AI Engineer is among the most common job titles in 2026, yet one of the least clearly defined.
slides.subtitle: Findings from 1,500+ job descriptions and repos, shared in a 3-part live series.

slides.title: What the series covers
slides.body: What the role entails, how companies run interviews, and how take-home assignments are assessed.

slides.title: 1) Defining the AI Engineer Role — Tue, Feb 24, 5:00 PM CET
slides.body: Insights from 1,500+ job descriptions. How AI engineer expectations differ from ML researchers. A typical day in the role.

slides.title: 2) The Interview Process — Tue, Mar 3, 5:00 PM CET
slides.body: Interview questions from recent candidates. How to explain architecture and model choices. Common coding and system design tasks.

slides.title: 3) Take-Home Assignments — Mon, Mar 9, 6:00 PM CET
slides.body: Examples from Q4 2025 and Q1 2026. What reviewers look for. An end-to-end document processing task.

slides.title: Virtual (Zoom) · Free
slides.body: For anyone preparing for AI engineering roles or considering this path.

slides.ctaText: Register to get the join link
slides.supportingText: Sign up to receive the link before each session.
